fields.title: Asymmetry: A Novel
fields.summary: This stunning debut comprises two novella-like sections, one about a young editor’s affair with an older author and the other about an Iraqi-American economist detained at Heathrow. The result is transgressive, shrewd and politically engaged.

fields.title: Brown: Poems
fields.summary: This new collection of verse by the poetry editor of The New Yorker (and director of the New York Public Library’s Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture) is political in the best, most visceral way — critical, angry, squinting hard at the culture — while remaining at the same time deeply and lovingly personal.

fields.title: An American Marriage: A Novel
fields.summary: Roy and Celestial are a young black couple in Atlanta “on the come up,” as he puts it, when he’s convicted of a rape he did not commit and sentenced to 12 years in prison. The unfairness of the years stolen from this couple by a great cosmic error forms the novel’s slow burn.
